meanings.definition: The quality or state of being saintly.
meanings.sent1: Her saintliness was evident in the way she always helped others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent2: The village admired the saintliness of the old priest who dedicated his life to serving the poor.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mischievous nature, his friends jokingly referred to him as the embodiment of saintliness.
meanings.sent4: The saintliness of her actions shone brightly in the darkness of despair, offering hope to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The aura of saintliness that surrounded her made even the toughest skeptics believe in goodness.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being morally pure and virtuous.
meanings.sent1: His saintliness was unquestionable, as he always chose the path of honesty and kindness.
meanings.sent2: The queen's saintliness inspired the kingdom to strive for higher moral standards.
meanings.sent3: In the world of politics, his saintliness was a rare gem, often overshadowed by cunning tactics.
meanings.sent4: The saintliness of her soul radiated through her actions, touching the hearts of all who crossed her path.
meanings.sent5: The purity of her saintliness was like a beacon of light in a world clouded by darkness.
